intro: Malaccotristicha, commonly known as the Malacca tristicha, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds.
